summary: This bill, the "Improving Reentry for District of Columbia Residents in the Bureau of Prisons Act of 2025," mandates that the Bureau of Prisons place certain incarcerated individuals who are residents of the District of Columbia within 250 miles of the District, no later than two years after the bill's enactment. Exceptions are made for extraordinary circumstances, requiring a written explanation to relevant congressional committees. The bill defines “covered individual” and “covered congressional committees” and specifies it does not restrict pre-release custody or supervised release transfers. The bill's intent is to improve reentry outcomes by maintaining proximity to the District of Columbia.
